meanings.definition: The quality or state of being swollen, bloated, or distended.
meanings.sent1: The turgidness of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The turgidness of the river after the heavy rain caused flooding.
meanings.sent3: The turgidness of the marshmallow made it comically oversized.
meanings.sent4: The turgidness of the clouds signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The turgidness of the balloon animal made it look ready to burst.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessively ornate or complex in style or language.
meanings.sent1: The turgidness of the speech confused the audience with its fancy words.
meanings.sent2: The turgidness of the painting overwhelmed the viewers with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The turgidness of the cake decoration made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The turgidness of the novel's prose created a barrier for casual readers.
meanings.sent5: The turgidness of the architecture left visitors in awe of its grandeur.
